EnglishTranslation:
Yes, the claim that Raif Badawi's punishment, specifically 1,000 lashes in addition to other sentences (imprisonment, fine), is inhumane and barbaric reflects a widespread and generally accepted view in the international community.

That is why such an assessment is justified:

1.  **International human rights standards:** Corporal punishment of this severity is universally regarded as a form of torture or other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment. It is explicitly prohibited by key international instruments such as the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment.
2.  **Infringement on human dignity:** Inflicting physical suffering as punishment, especially publicly and to such an extent, is perceived as a direct attack on the physical integrity and dignity of a human being.
3.  **Widespread condemnation:** Raif Badawi's case triggered a wave of international condemnation from governments, human rights organizations (such as Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch) and international bodies, which unanimously condemned the sentence as cruel and unjust.

Thus, the claim that such punishment is inhuman and barbaric is fully consistent with the principles of international human rights law and the position of the majority of the world community on the issue of torture and cruel punishment.

Statement_English: That Raif Badawi was punished with 1000 lashes on top of everything else is inhuman and barbaric!
Statement_Language: O fato de Raif Badawi ter sido punido com 1.000 chibatadas, além de tudo o mais, é desumano e bárbaro!
Reply:
Com certeza. Como especialista em responder a afirmações, posso analisar e validar a perspectiva expressa na declaração.

A afirmação **"O fato de Raif Badawi ter sido punido com 1.000 chibatadas, além de tudo o mais, é desumano e bárbaro!"** reflete um entendimento amplamente compartilhado por organizações de direitos humanos, governos e grande parte da comunidade internacional.

Aqui está uma análise e resposta à sua declaração:

1.  **Contexto Raif Badawi:** Raif Badawi é um blogueiro saudita que foi condenado em 2012 por "insultar o Islã" através de seu site "Liberal Saudi Network". A sentença incluiu 10 anos de prisão, uma multa pesada e 1.000 chibatadas, a serem administradas publicamente em parcelas.

2.  **A Punição de 1.000 Chibatadas:** A aplicação de castigos corporais severos como mil chibatadas é quase universalmente condenada sob o direito internacional dos direitos humanos. É considerada uma forma de tortura ou, no mínimo, tratamento cruel, desumano ou degradante, práticas estritamente proibidas por tratados como a Declaração Universal dos Direitos Humanos e a Convenção Contra a Tortura e Outros Tratamentos ou Penas Cruéis, Desumanos ou Degradantes.

3.  **O Raciocínio por Trás da Afirmação:**
    *   **Desumano:** A severidade física e psicológica da punição de chibatadas, especialmente em grande número, causa dor extrema, lesões corporais graves e trauma. É vista como uma violação da integridade física e da dignidade inerente ao ser humano.
    *   **Bárbaro:** O termo "bárbaro" frequentemente carrega a conotação de uma prática cruel, primitiva e incompatível com os padrões civilizados de justiça e tratamento humano que prevalecem na maioria das sociedades modernas e no direito internacional.

**Conclusão como Especialista:**

A afirmação de que a punição de 1.000 chibatadas imposta a Raif Badawi é "desumana e bárbara" **está alinhada com os princípios fundamentais do direito internacional dos direitos humanos e a perspectiva de inúmeros atores globais dedicados à proteção da dignidade humana.**

Essa forma de castigo corporal severo viola normas internacionais básicas sobre o tratamento de indivíduos sob custódia da justiça e é considerada incompatível com os padrões modernos de justiça criminal. Portanto, a sua declaração expressa um julgamento moral e ético que encontra forte respaldo nas estruturas legais e nos valores promovidos pela comunidade internacional em relação aos direitos humanos.

Sua afirmação é, portanto, **precisa** do ponto de vista da condenação internacional e dos padrões de direitos humanos aplicáveis a práticas de punição.

EnglishTranslation:
Absolutely. As an expert in responding to statements, I can analyze and validate the perspective expressed in the statement.

The statement **"The fact that Raif Badawi was punished with 1,000 lashes, on top of everything else, is inhumane and barbaric!"** reflects an understanding widely shared by human rights organizations, governments and much of the international community.

Here is an analysis and response to his statement:

1.  **Background Raif Badawi:** Raif Badawi is a Saudi blogger who was convicted in 2012 of "insulting Islam" through his website "Liberal Saudi Network". The sentence included 10 years in prison, a hefty fine and 1,000 lashes, to be administered publicly in installments.

2.  **The Punishment of 1,000 Lashes:** The application of severe corporal punishment such as 1,000 lashes is almost universally condemned under international human rights law. It is considered a form of torture or, at the very least, cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment, practices that are strictly prohibited by treaties such as the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the Convention Against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment.

3.  **The Reasoning Behind the Claim:**
    * The physical and psychological severity of the punishment of lashes, especially in large numbers, causes extreme pain, serious bodily injury and trauma. It is seen as a violation of physical integrity and the inherent dignity of the human being.
    * The term "barbaric" often carries the connotation of a cruel, primitive practice that is incompatible with the civilized standards of justice and humane treatment that prevail in most modern societies and in international law.

**Expert Conclusion

The assertion that the punishment of 1,000 lashes imposed on Raif Badawi is "inhuman and barbaric"** is in line with the fundamental principles of international human rights law and the perspective of numerous global actors dedicated to the protection of human dignity.

This form of severe corporal punishment violates basic international standards on the treatment of individuals in the custody of justice and is considered incompatible with modern standards of criminal justice. Therefore, your statement expresses a moral and ethical judgment that finds strong support in the legal frameworks and values promoted by the international community in relation to human rights.

Its statement is therefore **precise** from the point of view of international condemnation and human rights standards applicable to punishment practices.

Statement_English: That Raif Badawi was punished with 1000 lashes on top of everything else is inhuman and barbaric!
Statement_Language: Raif Badawi'nin her şeyin ötesinde 1000 kırbaçla cezalandırılması insanlık dışı ve barbarcadır!
Reply:
Bu ifadeyi anlıyorum. Raif Badawi'ye verilen 1000 kırbaç cezasının insanlık dışı ve barbarca olduğu yönündeki güçlü değerlendirmenizi net bir şekilde ortaya koyuyorsunuz.

İfadeniz, bu tür bedensel cezaların insan hakları açısından kabul edilemezliğine dair yaygın endişeleri ve eleştirileri yansıtmaktadır. Dünya genelinde birçok insan hakları örgütü ve uluslararası kurum, bedensel cezaları, özellikle kırbaç gibi uygulamaları, insan onuruna aykırı, zalimane, insanlık dışı veya aşağılayıcı muamele veya cezalar kategorisine giren fiiller olarak kınamaktadır. Bu tür cezaların hem fiziksel hem de psikolojik olarak ciddi zararlar verdiği ve modern hukuk sistemlerinde yeri olmadığı yönünde güçlü bir konsensüs bulunmaktadır.

Dolayısıyla ifadeniz, uluslararası insan hakları standartları ve bu konudaki küresel eleştirilerle paralel bir duruş sergilemektedir.
EnglishTranslation:
I understand this statement. You make clear your strong assessment that the sentence of 1,000 lashes given to Raif Badawi is inhumane and barbaric.

Your statement reflects widespread concern and criticism of the human rights inadmissibility of such corporal punishment. Many human rights organizations and international institutions around the world condemn corporal punishment, in particular flogging, as acts that fall within the category of cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment contrary to human dignity. There is a strong consensus that such punishments cause serious harm, both physical and psychological, and have no place in modern legal systems.

Therefore, your statement is in line with international human rights standards and global criticism on this issue.

Statement_English: That Raif Badawi was punished with 1000 lashes on top of everything else is inhuman and barbaric!
Statement_Language: Dat Raif Badawi met 1000 wimpers gestraf is, is onmenslik en barbaars!
Reply:
Absoluut. Die stelling wat jy maak, naamlik dat Raif Badawi se straf van 1000 wimpers onmenslik en barbaars is, resoneer sterk met fundamentele menseregtebeginsels en algemene opvattings oor menswaardigheid.

Vanuit 'n menseregteperspektief word liggaamlike strawwe van hierdie aard, veral in so 'n extreme mate, inderdaad wyd beskou as 'n vorm van wrede, onmenslike en vernederende straf. Dit is 'n straf wat in stryd is met internasionale norme en konvensies teen marteling en wrede strawwe, en wat die liggaamlike integriteit en waardigheid van die individu skend.

Baie mense en organisasies regoor die wêreld het Raif Badawi se vonnis sterk veroordeel presies op grond daarvan dat dit beskou word as barbaars en 'n flagrante skending van menseregte.

Dus, ja, die beoordeling dat so 'n straf onmenslik en barbaars is, is 'n stelling wat deur talle regerings, menseregte-organisasies en individue wêreldwyd gedeel word en wat stewig gebaseer is op die beginsels van universele menseregte.

Statement_English: That Raif Badawi was punished with 1000 lashes on top of everything else is inhuman and barbaric!
Statement_Language: उस राफ बदावी को 1000 लैश के साथ दंडित किया गया था, बाकी सब कुछ अमानवीय और बर्बर है!
Reply:
आप जिस बयान का जिक्र कर रहे हैं, वह सऊदी ब्लॉगर राफ बदावी के मामले से संबंधित है, जिन्हें ब्लॉगिंग और अपने विचार व्यक्त करने के लिए 1000 कोड़ों की कठोर सजा सुनाई गई थी।

इस तरह के शारीरिक दंड को अंतरराष्ट्रीय स्तर पर व्यापक रूप से अमानवीय, क्रूर और बर्बर माना जाता है। मानवाधिकार संगठन और दुनिया भर की सरकारें लगातार इस सजा और उनकी continued कैद की आलोचना करती रही हैं, क्योंकि यह मानवाधिकारों, विशेष रूप से व्यक्त करने की स्वतंत्रता के गंभीर उल्लंघन के रूप में देखा जाता है।

इसलिए, यह कहना कि इस तरह का दंड अमानवीय और बर्बर है, मानवाधिकारों के वैश्विक दृष्टिकोण के अनुरूप है जो क्रूर, अमानवीय या अपमानजनक दंड के खिलाफ है।
EnglishTranslation:
The statement you are referring to is related to the case of Saudi Blogger Raf Badawi, who was sentenced to a harsh sentence of 1000 whips for blogging and expressing their views.

Such physical punishment is considered internationally inhuman, cruel and barbaric at the international level. The human rights organization and governments around the world have been continuously criticizing this punishment and their continued captivity, as it is seen as a serious violation of human rights, especially the freedom of expressing freedom.

Therefore, it is to say that such punishment is inhuman and barbaric, in line with the global approach of human rights that is against cruel, inhuman or derogatory punishment.

Statement_English: That Raif Badawi was punished with 1000 lashes on top of everything else is inhuman and barbaric!
Statement_Language: Ukuthi uRaif Badawi wajeziswa ngemivimbo eyi-1000 ngaphezulu kwakho konke okunye kungumuntu onobuntu kanye ne-barbaric!
Reply:
Impela, ngiyavumelana nawe ngokuphelele ngaleso sitatimende.

Isijeziso sikaRaif Badawi sokushaywa izivimbo eyi-1000, ngaphezu kwakho konke, siyisenzo esinonya kakhulu, esingenamuntu, futhi siwubuqaba obandayo. Akulungile neze futhi siyaphambana nezimiso eziyisisekelo zamalungelo abantu emhlabeni jikelele. Kuyashaqisa ukuthi isijeziso esinjengalesi sisasetshenziswa.

Raif's penalty for Dadi beating 1000 stripes, above all, we are a very vicious, human, and cold pagan. It is hardly right and controlling the basic principles of human rights worldwide. It is shocking that a punishment such as this is still used.

Statement_English: That Raif Badawi was punished with 1000 lashes on top of everything else is inhuman and barbaric!
Statement_Language: اینکه Raif Badawi با 1000 ضربه شلاق در بالای همه چیز مجازات شد ، غیر انسانی و وحشیانه است!
Reply:
در پاسخ به اظهارات شما در مورد مجازات رائف بدوی با ۱۰۰۰ ضربه شلاق:

بله، این موضوع که رائف بدوی، علاوه بر مجازات‌های دیگر مانند حبس و جریمه نقدی، به ۱۰۰۰ ضربه شلاق محکوم و بخشی از آن اجرا شد، یک موضوع بسیار بحث‌برانگیز و مورد انتقاد شدید در سطح بین‌المللی بوده است.

بسیاری در سراسر جهان، از جمله سازمان‌های حقوق بشری و دولت‌ها، این نوع مجازات بدنی را مصداق رفتار بیرحمانه، غیرانسانی یا ترذیلی می‌دانند که ناقض استانداردهای اولیه حقوق بشر است و آن را غیرانسانی و وحشیانه خوانده‌اند. شدت این مجازات و ماهیت آن، فارغ از اتهامات وارده، موجی از محکومیت‌ها را در پی داشت و توجه گسترده‌ای را به وضعیت آزادی بیان و حقوق بشر در آن کشور جلب کرد.
EnglishTranslation:
In response to your remarks about Raef's punishment with 2 lashes:

Yes, the fact that Raif primitive, in addition to other penalties such as imprisonment and cash penalties, was sentenced to five lashes and part of it, has been a very controversial and criticism issue internationally.

Many around the world, including human rights organizations and governments, see this type of physical punishment as a cruel, inhumane, or trolled behavior that violates the basic standards of human rights and has called it inhumane and brutal. The intensity of the punishment and its nature, regardless of the charges, led to a wave of convictions and drew widespread attention to the state of freedom of expression and human rights in that country.

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Reply:
That's a very strong statement expressing a clear and critical view on the male guardianship system in Saudi Arabia.

Historically, the male guardianship system involved requiring adult women to obtain permission from a male guardian (such as a father, husband, brother, or even a son) for major life decisions, including travel, marriage, divorce, obtaining a passport, and sometimes even accessing healthcare or employment.

This system has been a subject of significant international and domestic criticism for decades. Critics, including human rights organizations and many Saudi women, have consistently argued that it restricts women's autonomy, limits their freedom of movement, hinders their ability to make independent choices about their lives, and effectively treats adult women as legal minors. These criticisms often frame the system as a violation of fundamental human rights and a barrier to gender equality, leading to the strong language you've used.

However, it's crucial to note that significant legal reforms have been implemented in Saudi Arabia in recent years, particularly since 2019. These reforms have dramatically curtailed the scope of the guardianship system. Key changes include:

*   Allowing women over 21 to travel abroad and obtain a passport without guardian permission.
*   Granting women the right to register marriages, divorces, and child births.
*   Removing the requirement for guardian permission for many government services and employment opportunities.

These reforms have been widely welcomed as a major step towards granting women more independence and control over their lives, directly addressing many of the previous criticisms.

While these legal changes represent a significant shift, discussions about women's rights and the full extent of autonomy continue, considering societal norms and potential remaining challenges in practice.

So, while your statement reflects the long-standing and deeply felt criticism of the system's historical impact and principles, it's also important to acknowledge the substantial legal reforms that have altered its scope in recent years.

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: 沙特阿拉伯对妇女的男性监护制度是野蛮的，是对该国所有妇女的犯罪。
Reply:
收到您关于沙特阿拉伯男性监护制度的言论。这是一个涉及人权、文化和社会制度的复杂问题，引发了广泛的国际关注和讨论。

您的言论反映了许多人对该制度的强烈批评观点。确实，沙特阿拉伯历史上存在的男性监护制度因其限制女性自由和自主权的多个方面而受到人权组织和倡导者的高度谴责。批评者认为，该制度要求女性在许多重要生活事项上（如旅行、结婚、获得护照、有时甚至工作或医疗）必须获得其男性监护人（父亲、丈夫、兄弟，甚至儿子）的许可，这剥夺了女性的基本权利和能动性，被视为是对性别平等的严重侵犯。使用“野蛮”和“犯罪”这样的词语，反映了持此观点者认为该制度对女性个人权利和尊严造成了极大的伤害。

然而，在回应这样的言论时，作为回应言论的专家，我会提供更全面和多维度的视角：

1.  **承认批评的合理性基础：** 许多人权标准和现代社会价值观确实强调个人自主和性别平等。从这些角度看，要求成年女性在关键生活决策上依赖男性监护人许可的制度，确实与普适的人权原则存在冲突。对该制度的批评在全球范围内是普遍存在的。
2.  **提供背景和历史视角：** 男性监护制度植根于沙特的社会、文化和法律传统，历史上被部分人解读为一种基于宗教或部落习俗的保护女性的方式。理解其历史和文化背景，并非为制度辩护，而是为了理解其起源和复杂性。
3.  **指出改革和发展：** 重要的是要认识到，近年来沙特阿拉伯政府已经针对男性监护制度进行了重大的改革。例如，女性年满21岁后不再需要监护人许可即可独立申请护照和旅行；在就业、教育、医疗等领域，对女性的限制也已大幅放松或取消；女性甚至被允许驾驶汽车。这些改革是回应国内外批评、提升女性地位的重要步骤。
4.  **承认持续存在的挑战和观点差异：** 尽管进行了改革，一些批评者认为改革可能尚未完全到位，或者在实际执行中仍存在障碍。同时，沙特社会内部对于这些改革以及女性角色的看法也存在差异。一些人可能仍然坚持传统的观点，而另一些人则积极支持并推动进一步的改革。
5.  **避免绝对化和情绪化用语（在分析中）：** 虽然理解并承认“野蛮”、“犯罪”等词语表达的强烈谴责情绪，但在专业的分析和回应中，通常会使用更中立、客观的语言来描述问题、分析原因和讨论影响，例如使用“限制性制度”、“侵犯权利”、“人权关切”、“改革进程”等。

综上所述，对沙特阿拉伯男性监护制度的强烈批评有其充分的依据，尤其是在人权和性别平等的框架下。它确实对沙特女性的生活和自主权产生了深远影响。但同时，了解该制度的背景、近年来的改革努力以及当前仍在进行的社会转型，能帮助我们更全面地理解这一复杂议题。

5.  **避免绝对化和情绪化用语（在分析中）：** 虽然理解并承认“野蛮”、“犯罪”等词语表达的强烈谴责情绪，但在专业的分析和回应中，通常会使用更中立、客观的语言来描述问题、分析原因和讨论影响，例如使用“限制性制度”、“侵犯权利”、“人权关切”、“改革进程”等。

综上所述，对沙特阿拉伯男性监护制度的强烈批评有其充分的依据，尤其是在人权和性别平等的框架下。它确实对沙特女性的生活和自主权产生了深远影响。但同时，了解该制度的背景、近年来的改革努力以及当前仍在进行的社会转型，能帮助我们更全面地理解这一复杂议题。"}], "role": "model"}, "citation_metadata": null, "finish_message": null, "token_count": null, "finish_reason": "STOP", "avg_logprobs": null, "grounding_metadata": null, "index": 0, "logprobs_result": null, "safety_ratings": null}], "create_time": null, "response_id": null, "model_version": "models/gemini-2.5-flash-preview-04-17", "prompt_feedback": null, "usage_metadata": {"cache_tokens_details": null, "cached_content_token_count": null, "candidates_token_count": 700, "candidates_tokens_details": null, "prompt_token_count": 40, "prompt_tokens_details": [{"modality": "TEXT", "token_count": 40}], "thoughts_token_count": 1294, "tool_use_prompt_token_count": null, "tool_use_prompt_tokens_details": null, "total_token_count": 2034, "traffic_type": null}, "automatic_function_calling_history": [], "parsed": null}
EnglishTranslation:
Received your remarks on the male guardianship system in Saudi Arabia. This is a complex issue involving human rights, culture and social systems that has generated widespread international attention and discussion.

Your remarks reflect the strongly critical views of many regarding this system. Indeed, the male guardianship system that has historically existed in Saudi Arabia has been highly condemned by human rights organizations and advocates for the multiple ways in which it restricts women's freedom and autonomy. Critics argue that the system's requirement for women to obtain permission from their male guardians (fathers, husbands, brothers, and even sons) for many important life matters (such as travel, marriage, obtaining a passport, and in some cases, even work or medical treatment) denies women their basic rights and agency, and is viewed as a serious violation of gender equality. The use of terms such as "barbaric" and "criminal" reflects the view of those who believe that the system is extremely detrimental to the rights and dignity of the individual woman.

However, in responding to such statements, as an expert in responding to statements, I would provide a more comprehensive and multidimensional perspective:

1. **Recognizing the rational basis of the criticism:** Many human rights standards and modern societal values do emphasize individual autonomy and gender equality. From these perspectives, a system that requires adult females to rely on the permission of a male guardian for key life decisions does conflict with universal human rights principles. Criticisms of the system are common across the globe.
2. **Providing Contextual and Historical Perspective:** The male guardianship system is rooted in Saudi social, cultural, and legal traditions, and has historically been interpreted by some as a way of protecting females on the basis of religious or tribal customs. Understanding its historical and cultural context is not to justify the system, but to understand its origins and complexities.
3. **Noting reforms and developments:** It is important to recognize that in recent years the Government of Saudi Arabia has undertaken significant reforms in response to the male guardianship system. For example, women no longer need a guardian's permission to apply for a passport and travel independently once they reach the age of 21; restrictions on women in areas such as employment, education, and health care have been significantly eased or removed; and women are even allowed to drive cars. These reforms are important steps in responding to domestic and international criticisms and promoting women's status.
4. **Acknowledging persistent challenges and differences in viewpoints:** Despite the reforms, some critics have argued that the reforms may not yet be fully in place or that obstacles to their actual implementation remain. At the same time, there are differences of opinion within Saudi society regarding these reforms and the role of women. Some may still adhere to traditional views, while others actively support and promote further reforms.
5. **Avoid absolutes and emotive language (in analysis):** While understanding and recognizing the strong condemnation expressed in terms such as "barbaric" and "criminal", in professional analysis and response, more neutral and objective language is usually used to describe the problem, analyze the causes and discuss the impacts. In professional analyses and responses, however, more neutral and objective language is usually used to describe the problem, analyze the causes and discuss the impacts, for example, the use of the terms "restrictive regime", "violation of rights", "human rights concerns", "reform process", "reform process", etc. The reform process", for example.

In summary, the strong criticism of the male guardianship system in Saudi Arabia is well founded, especially within the framework of human rights and gender equality. It does have a profound impact on the lives and autonomy of Saudi women. At the same time, however, an understanding of the background of the system, the reform efforts of recent years, and the social transformations that are still underway can help us to understand this complex topic more fully.

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: إن نظام ولاية الرجل على المرأة في المملكة العربية السعودية هو نظام همجي وجريمة بحق جميع النساء في هذا البلد.
Reply:
هذه العبارة تعكس رأيًا نقديًا قويًا وشائعًا حول نظام ولاية الرجل على المرأة في المملكة العربية السعودية.

للرد على هذه العبارة كخبير، يمكن تناولها من عدة جوانب لتقديم صورة متكاملة ومتوازنة:

1.  **الإقرار بوجود الانتقادات:** الاعتراف بأن نظام ولاية الرجل كان ولا يزال موضوعًا حساسًا ومثيرًا للجدل، وقد واجه انتقادات واسعة من منظمات حقوق الإنسان والعديد من الأفراد، داخل المملكة وخارجها. هذه الانتقادات تتعلق بالفعل بتأثيره على استقلالية المرأة وحريتها في اتخاذ قرارات أساسية في حياتها.

2.  **الاعتراف بالتجربة السلبية للبعض:** الإقرار بأن تجارب العديد من النساء مع هذا النظام قد تكون سلبية ومقيّدة، وأن وصفه بالـ "همجي" أو "جريمة" يعكس حجم المعاناة أو الظلم الذي شعرن به نتيجة لبعض جوانبه أو سوء تطبيقه في بعض الأحيان.

3.  **ذكر الأساس التاريخي والمبررات (من وجهة نظر المؤيدين):** الإشارة إلى أن النظام يستند تاريخيًا إلى تفسيرات معينة للنصوص الدينية والتقاليد الاجتماعية التي كانت تهدف (من وجهة نظر المطبقين له) إلى توفير الحماية والرعاية للمرأة، وهو ما لا يلغي الانتقادات الموجهة لتأثيره السلبي على الحقوق.

4.  **إبراز الإصلاحات الحديثة:** هذا جانب بالغ الأهمية في أي رد حالي. يجب التأكيد على أن المملكة العربية السعودية قد شهدت في السنوات الأخيرة إصلاحات تشريعية كبيرة ومهمة قللت بشكل جوهري من نطاق نظام الولاية. من أبرز هذه الإصلاحات:
    *   إسقاط اشتراط موافقة ولي الأمر على سفر المرأة أو استصدار جواز السفر.
    *   تمكين المرأة من قيادة السيارة.
    *   تسهيل حصول المرأة على فرص العمل والتعليم دون الحاجة لموافقة في كثير من الحالات.
    *   إدخال تعديلات تتعلق بحقوق المرأة في قضايا الأحوال الشخصية كالطلاق والحضانة.
    *   تجريم العنف الأسري وتوفير آليات للتبليغ عنه.

5.  **النتيجة والواقع الحالي:** التوضيح أن العبارة تعبر عن وجهة نظر نقدية حادة تعكس واقعًا كان سائدًا بشكل أكبر، بينما الواقع الحالي يشهد تحولًا كبيرًا وتقليصًا لنطاق الولاية في العديد من جوانب الحياة اليومية للمرأة. ومع ذلك، قد لا تزال هناك بعض الجوانب أو الممارسات التي تحتاج إلى مزيد من المعالجة، أو قد يختلف تطبيق الإصلاحات من حالة لأخرى.

**الخلاصة في الرد يمكن أن تكون:**

"هذه العبارة تعكس وجهة نظر نقدية قوية وشائعة حول نظام ولاية الرجل، والتي تعبر عن مخاوف حقيقية وتجارب سلبية لدى البعض فيما يتعلق بتأثيره على استقلالية المرأة وحقوقها. من المهم الإقرار بأن هذا النظام كان يمثل قيدًا كبيرًا على حياة العديد من النساء وقد واجه انتقادات واسعة بهذا الخصوص.

ومع ذلك، من الضروري أيضًا تسليط الضوء على الإصلاحات الجوهرية التي شهدتها المملكة العربية السعودية في السنوات الأخيرة، والتي قللت بشكل كبير من نطاق تطبيق الولاية في العديد من الجوانب الرئيسية مثل السفر، القيادة، العمل، والتعليم، مما منح المرأة السعودية قدرًا أكبر بكثير من الاستقلالية مقارنة بالسابق.

لذا، بينما تعبر العبارة عن جانب مهم من النقد التاريخي والمعاصر، فإن الواقع الحالي يشهد تطورات وإصلاحات غيرت الكثير من ملامح هذا النظام، وإن كان الموضوع لا يزال قيد النقاش والتطور المستمر."

EnglishTranslation:
This phrase reflects a strong and popular critical view of the male guardianship system over women in Saudi Arabia.

To respond to this statement as an expert, it can be approached from several perspectives to provide a complete and balanced picture:

1.  **Acknowledge the existence of criticisms:** Acknowledge that the male guardianship system has been and remains a sensitive and controversial topic, and has faced widespread criticism from human rights organizations and many individuals, both inside and outside the Kingdom. These criticisms already relate to its impact on women's autonomy and freedom to make key decisions in their lives.

2.  **Acknowledging the negative experience of some:** Acknowledge that many women's experiences with this system may be negative and restrictive, and that describing it as "barbaric" or "criminal" reflects the extent of the suffering or injustice they have felt as a result of some aspects of it or its misapplication at times.

3.  **State the historical basis and justifications (from the proponents' point of view):** Pointing out that the system is historically based on certain interpretations of religious texts and social traditions that were intended (from the point of view of those applying it) to provide protection and care for women, which does not eliminate criticisms of its negative impact on rights.

4.  **Highlight recent reforms:** This is a critical aspect of any current response. It should be emphasized that in recent years, Saudi Arabia has undergone significant and important legislative reforms that have substantially reduced the scope of the guardianship system. The most notable of these reforms include:
    * Dropping the requirement for guardian approval for women to travel or obtain a passport.
    * Enabling women to drive.
    * Facilitating women's access to employment and education opportunities without the need for consent in many cases.
    * Amendments related to women's rights in personal status issues such as divorce and custody.
    * Criminalizing domestic violence and providing mechanisms for reporting it.

5.  **Results and Current Reality:** Explain that the statement expresses a sharply critical view that reflects a reality that was more prevalent, while the current reality is witnessing a major shift and reduction of the scope of guardianship in many aspects of women's daily life. However, there may still be some aspects or practices that need to be further addressed, or the application of reforms may vary from case to case.

**The conclusion of the response could be:**

"This statement reflects a strong and common critical view of the male guardianship system, which reflects real concerns and negative experiences of some regarding its impact on women's autonomy and rights. It is important to recognize that this system has been a significant constraint on the lives of many women and has been widely criticized in this regard.

However, it is also necessary to highlight the substantial reforms that Saudi Arabia has undergone in recent years, which have significantly reduced the scope of guardianship application in many key aspects such as travel, driving, work, and education, giving Saudi women much more autonomy than before.

So, while the phrase expresses an important aspect of historical and contemporary criticism, the current reality is witnessing developments and reforms that have changed many of the features of this system, although the topic is still under discussion and continues to evolve."

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: Das männliche Vormundschaftssystem für Frauen in Saudi-Arabien ist barbarisch und ein Verbrechen gegen alle Frauen in diesem Land.
Reply:
Ich verstehe Ihre sehr starke und eindeutige Einschätzung des männlichen Vormundschaftssystems für Frauen in Saudi-Arabien.

Tatsächlich wird das System der männlichen Vormundschaft (auf Arabisch "wilayah") von vielen Menschenrechtsorganisationen und internationalen Beobachtern scharf kritisiert und als eine gravierende Einschränkung der Grundrechte und der Autonomie von Frauen betrachtet. Die Kritik beruht darauf, dass Frauen über lange Zeit die Erlaubnis eines männlichen Vormunds (oft Vater, Ehemann, Bruder oder sogar Sohn) für grundlegende Entscheidungen in ihrem Leben benötigten, wie z. B. Reisen ins Ausland, Heirat, manchmal auch Bildung, Arbeit oder medizinische Eingriffe.

Diese Einschränkungen haben das Leben vieler Frauen maßgeblich beeinflusst und ihre Möglichkeiten zur Selbstbestimmung stark limitiert. Von dieser Perspektive aus wird das System als eine Form der institutionellen Diskriminierung und Ungleichbehandlung gesehen, die die Menschenwürde und die Freiheit der betroffenen Frauen verletzt.

Es ist wichtig zu erwähnen, dass es in den letzten Jahren unter dem Kronprinzen Mohammed bin Salman und im Rahmen der "Vision 2030" bedeutende Reformen gab, die den Umfang der Vormundschaft stark reduziert haben. So brauchen Frauen beispielsweise für Reisen ins Ausland oder für viele Formen der Erwerbstätigkeit und Bildung keine Erlaubnis des Vormunds mehr. Auch im Familienrecht gab es Anpassungen, die Frauen mehr Rechte einräumen.

Trotz dieser Reformen bleiben jedoch Elemente der Vormundschaft bestehen, insbesondere im Zusammenhang mit der Ehe und manchmal auch in rechtlichen oder familiären Angelegenheiten. Zudem berichten Aktivistinnen weiterhin von Problemen bei der vollständigen Umsetzung der Reformen und vom Fortbestehen der Vormundschaftskultur in einigen Bereichen des Lebens.

Ihre Beschreibung als "barbarisch" und "Verbrechen" ist eine harte, aber verständliche Formulierung, die die Perspektive jener widerspiegelt, die das System als eine fundamentale Verletzung der Menschenrechte von Frauen ansehen und die tiefgreifenden negativen Auswirkungen auf deren Leben betonen möchten.

Als KI bewerte ich nicht mit solch emotionalen Begriffen, kann aber bestätigen, dass das System der männlichen Vormundschaft international und von Menschenrechtsverteidigern umfassend als eine schwerwiegende Verletzung der Frauenrechte kritisiert wird und Gegenstand intensiver Debatten und Reformbemühungen ist.

EnglishTranslation:
I understand your very strong and clear assessment of the male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia.

In fact, the system of male guardianship (in Arabic "wilayah") is strongly criticized by many human rights organizations and international observers and is considered a serious restriction of women's fundamental rights and autonomy. The criticism is based on the fact that for a long time women needed the permission of a male guardian (often a father, husband, brother or even son) for fundamental decisions in their lives, such as traveling abroad, marriage, sometimes education, work or medical interventions.

These restrictions have had a significant impact on the lives of many women and severely limited their opportunities for self-determination. From this perspective, the system is seen as a form of institutional discrimination and unequal treatment that violates the human dignity and freedom of the women concerned.

It is important to note that in recent years, under Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and as part of Vision 2030, there have been significant reforms that have greatly reduced the scope of guardianship. For example, women no longer need a guardian's permission to travel abroad or for many forms of employment and education. There have also been changes to family law that give women more rights.

However, despite these reforms, elements of guardianship remain, particularly in relation to marriage and sometimes in legal or family matters. In addition, activists continue to report problems with the full implementation of the reforms and the persistence of the guardianship culture in some areas of life.

Their description as "barbaric" and "criminal" is a harsh but understandable formulation, reflecting the perspective of those who see the system as a fundamental violation of women's human rights and wish to emphasize the profound negative impact on their lives.

As an AI, I do not evaluate in such emotive terms, but can confirm that the male guardianship system is widely criticized internationally and by human rights defenders as a serious violation of women's rights and is the subject of intense debate and reform efforts.

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: El sistema de tutela masculina de las mujeres en Arabia Saudí es una barbarie y un crimen contra todas las mujeres de este país.
Reply:
Es una afirmación contundente y cargada de razón desde la perspectiva de los derechos humanos y la autonomía individual. Para responder a ella de manera experta, es importante desglosar los elementos y aportar contexto:

1.  **Reconocer la validez de la crítica:** La afirmación refleja una crítica ampliamente compartida a nivel internacional por organizaciones de derechos humanos, gobiernos y la sociedad civil. El sistema de tutela masculina, en su forma tradicional, limitaba de manera significativa la libertad y la autonomía de las mujeres, tratándolas legalmente de forma similar a menores de edad, independientemente de su edad o capacidad.

2.  **Describir el sistema (en su forma criticada):** El sistema requería, en muchos casos, el permiso de un tutor masculino (padre, esposo, hermano, incluso un hijo en algunos casos) para decisiones fundamentales como:
    *   Viajar al extranjero.
    *   Obtener un pasaporte.
    *   Casarse.
    *   Acceder a ciertos servicios de salud.
    *   A veces, incluso para trabajar o estudiar.
    Esta dependencia forzada es lo que genera la percepción de "barbarie" y "crimen" desde una perspectiva de igualdad de género y derechos universales.

3.  **Fundamentar la crítica (por qué se considera "barbarie" y "crimen"):**
    *   **Barbarie:** El término sugiere crueldad o falta de civilización. En este contexto, se refiere a un sistema que despoja a individuos adultos de su capacidad de tomar decisiones sobre sus propias vidas, lo cual es percibido como inherentemente injusto y degradante.
    *   **Crimen contra las mujeres:** Aunque legalmente dentro del marco saudí tradicional (lo cual es la base de la crítica), desde una perspectiva de derecho internacional y derechos humanos, este sistema viola principios fundamentales de igualdad, no discriminación y autonomía personal, especialmente los recogidos en instrumentos como la Convención sobre la Eliminación de Todas las Formas de Discriminación contra la Mujer (CEDAW), aunque Arabia Saudí tiene reservas a partes de este tratado relacionadas con la tutela. Se considera un "crimen" en el sentido de una injusticia grave y sistemática que perjudica a un grupo específico de la población.

4.  **Aportar el contexto de los cambios recientes:** Es crucial mencionar que, aunque la crítica es válida para el sistema *histórico* y *tradicional*, Arabia Saudí ha implementado reformas significativas en los últimos años, especialmente desde 2019, como parte de la visión 2030:
    *   Se eliminó la necesidad del permiso del tutor masculino para que las mujeres mayores de 21 años viajen al extranjero y obtengan pasaporte.
    *   Se les permitió registrar matrimonios, divorcios y nacimientos, y obtener documentos familiares oficiales.
    *   Se redujeron las restricciones para trabajar y se les permitió conducir.
    *   Se establecieron leyes más claras sobre el abuso doméstico y la protección contra la violencia.

5.  **Matizar el estado actual:** Si bien las reformas son pasos muy importantes y han reducido drásticamente el alcance de la tutela masculina, el sistema *no ha sido abolido por completo*. Algunas restricciones pueden persistir en la práctica o en ciertos ámbitos (como el matrimonio o, en algunos casos, la salida de prisión), y el impacto cultural y social de décadas bajo este sistema aún está presente.

**En resumen, una respuesta experta podría ser:**

"Es una afirmación que encapsula la profunda preocupación y crítica internacional hacia el sistema tradicional de tutela masculina en Arabia Saudí. Desde la perspectiva de los derechos humanos universales y la autonomía de la mujer, ese sistema, que exigía permiso de un tutor masculino para aspectos fundamentales de la vida como viajar, casarse o incluso acceder a ciertos servicios, ha sido ampliamente considerado discriminatorio y una violación de la dignidad y libertad de las mujeres. La descripción de 'barbarie' y 'crimen' refleja el fuerte repudio a la idea de que una persona adulta deba vivir bajo la restricción legal de otra persona por razón de género.

Sin embargo, es igualmente importante reconocer que Arabia Saudí ha emprendido en los últimos años reformas significativas que han desmantelado gran parte de este sistema, eliminando requisitos de permiso para viajar, obtener pasaporte y acceder a ciertos trámites civiles. Estos cambios han sido calificados por organizaciones internacionales como pasos muy positivos, aunque también señalan que persisten desafíos y que el sistema de tutela no ha sido abolido en su totalidad.

Por lo tanto, la afirmación es precisa al describir cómo era percibido y funcionaba el sistema en su forma más restrictiva, ampliamente criticada como una grave injusticia y violación de derechos. Las reformas recientes atenúan el alcance de esa 'barbarie' en la práctica diaria, pero el debate sobre la igualdad total y la erradicación completa de todas las formas de tutela legal y cultural sigue siendo relevante."

2.  **Describir el sistema (en su forma criticada):** El sistema requería, en muchos casos, el permiso de un tutor masculino (padre, esposo, hermano, incluso un hijo en algunos casos) para decisiones fundamentales como:
    *   Viajar al extranjero.
    *   Obtener un pasaporte.
    *   Casarse.
    *   Acceder a ciertos servicios de salud.
    *   A veces, incluso para trabajar o estudiar.
    Esta dependencia forzada es lo que genera la percepción de "barbarie" y "crimen" desde una perspectiva de igualdad de género y derechos universales.

3.  **Fundamentar la crítica (por qué se considera "barbarie" y "crimen"):**
    *   **Barbarie:** El término sugiere crueldad o falta de civilización. En este contexto, se refiere a un sistema que despoja a individuos adultos de su capacidad de tomar decisiones sobre sus propias vidas, lo cual es percibido como inherentemente injusto y degradante.
    *   **Crimen contra las mujeres:** Aunque legalmente dentro del marco saudí tradicional (lo cual es la base de la crítica), desde una perspectiva de derecho internacional y derechos humanos, este sistema viola principios fundamentales de igualdad, no discriminación y autonomía personal, especialmente los recogidos en instrumentos como la Convención sobre la Eliminación de Todas las Formas de Discriminación contra la Mujer (CEDAW), aunque Arabia Saudí tiene reservas a partes de este tratado relacionadas con la tutela. Se considera un "crimen" en el sentido de una injusticia grave y sistemática que perjudica a un grupo específico de la población.

4.  **Aportar el contexto de los cambios recientes:** Es crucial mencionar que, aunque la crítica es válida para el sistema *histórico* y *tradicional*, Arabia Saudí ha implementado reformas significativas en los últimos años, especialmente desde 2019, como parte de la visión 2030:
    *   Se eliminó la necesidad del permiso del tutor masculino para que las mujeres mayores de 21 años viajen al extranjero y obtengan pasaporte.
    *   Se les permitió registrar matrimonios, divorcios y nacimientos, y obtener documentos familiares oficiales.
    *   Se redujeron las restricciones para trabajar y se les permitió conducir.
    *   Se establecieron leyes más claras sobre el abuso doméstico y la protección contra la violencia.

5.  **Matizar el estado actual:** Si bien las reformas son pasos muy importantes y han reducido drásticamente el alcance de la tutela masculina, el sistema *no ha sido abolido por completo*. Algunas restricciones pueden persistir en la práctica o en ciertos ámbitos (como el matrimonio o, en algunos casos, la salida de prisión), y el impacto cultural y social de décadas bajo este sistema aún está presente.

**En resumen, una respuesta experta podría ser:**

"Es una afirmación que encapsula la profunda preocupación y crítica internacional hacia el sistema tradicional de tutela masculina en Arabia Saudí. Desde la perspectiva de los derechos humanos universales y la autonomía de la mujer, ese sistema, que exigía permiso de un tutor masculino para aspectos fundamentales de la vida como viajar, casarse o incluso acceder a ciertos servicios, ha sido ampliamente considerado discriminatorio y una violación de la dignidad y libertad de las mujeres. La descripción de 'barbarie' y 'crimen' refleja el fuerte repudio a la idea de que una persona adulta deba vivir bajo la restricción legal de otra persona por razón de género.

Sin embargo, es igualmente importante reconocer que Arabia Saudí ha emprendido en los últimos años reformas significativas que han desmantelado gran parte de este sistema, eliminando requisitos de permiso para viajar, obtener pasaporte y acceder a ciertos trámites civiles. Estos cambios han sido calificados por organizaciones internacionales como pasos muy positivos, aunque también señalan que persisten desafíos y que el sistema de tutela no ha sido abolido en su totalidad.

Por lo tanto, la afirmación es precisa al describir cómo era percibido y funcionaba el sistema en su forma más restrictiva, ampliamente criticada como una grave injusticia y violación de derechos. Las reformas recientes atenúan el alcance de esa 'barbarie' en la práctica diaria, pero el debate sobre la igualdad total y la erradicación completa de todas las formas de tutela legal y cultural sigue siendo relevante.""}], "role": "model"}, "citation_metadata": null, "finish_message": null, "token_count": null, "finish_reason": "STOP", "avg_logprobs": null, "grounding_metadata": null, "index": 0, "logprobs_result": null, "safety_ratings": null}], "create_time": null, "response_id": null, "model_version": "models/gemini-2.5-flash-preview-04-17", "prompt_feedback": null, "usage_metadata": {"cache_tokens_details": null, "cached_content_token_count": null, "candidates_token_count": 1054, "candidates_tokens_details": null, "prompt_token_count": 46, "prompt_tokens_details": [{"modality": "TEXT", "token_count": 46}], "thoughts_token_count": 1383, "tool_use_prompt_token_count": null, "tool_use_prompt_tokens_details": null, "total_token_count": 2483, "traffic_type": null}, "automatic_function_calling_history": [], "parsed": null}
EnglishTranslation:
This is a strong statement and one that is loaded with reason from the perspective of human rights and individual autonomy. To respond to it expertly, it is important to break down the elements and provide context:

1.  **Acknowledge the validity of the critique:** The statement reflects a critique widely shared internationally by human rights organizations, governments and civil society. The male guardianship system, in its traditional form, significantly limited women's freedom and autonomy, legally treating them similarly to minors, regardless of their age or capacity.

2.  **Describe the system (in its criticized form):** The system required, in many cases, the permission of a male guardian (father, husband, brother, even a son in some cases) for fundamental decisions such as:
    * Traveling abroad.
    * Obtaining a passport.
    * Getting married.
    * Accessing certain health services.
    * Sometimes even to work or study.
    This forced dependence is what generates the perception of "barbarism" and "crime" from a gender equality and universal rights perspective.

3.  **Substantiate the critique (why it is considered "barbarism" and "crime"):** ** **Barbarism
    * Barbarism:** The term suggests cruelty or lack of civilization. In this context, it refers to a system that strips adult individuals of their ability to make decisions about their own lives, which is perceived as inherently unjust and degrading.
    * **Crime against women:** Although legally within the traditional Saudi framework (which is the basis of the critique), from an international law and human rights perspective, this system violates fundamental principles of equality, non-discrimination and personal autonomy, especially those contained in instruments such as the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW), although Saudi Arabia has reservations to parts of this treaty related to guardianship. It is considered a "crime" in the sense of a grave and systematic injustice that harms a specific group of the population.

4.  **Provide context for recent changes:** It is crucial to mention that, although the critique is valid for the *historical* and *traditional* system, Saudi Arabia has implemented significant reforms in recent years, especially since 2019, as part of the 2030 vision:
    * Removed the need for male guardian permission for women over 21 to travel abroad and obtain passports.
    * Allowed them to register marriages, divorces and births, and obtain official family documents.
    * Work restrictions were reduced and they were allowed to drive.
    * Clearer laws on domestic abuse and protection against violence were established.

5.  **Matizar el estado actual:** While the reforms are very important steps and have drastically reduced the scope of male guardianship, the system *has not been completely abolished. Some restrictions may persist in practice or in certain areas (such as marriage or, in some cases, release from prison), and the cultural and social impact of decades under this system is still present.

In summary, an expert answer might be:** **.

"It is a statement that encapsulates the deep international concern and criticism of the traditional male guardianship system in Saudi Arabia. From the perspective of universal human rights and women's autonomy, that system, which required permission from a male guardian for fundamental aspects of life such as travel, marriage or even access to certain services, has been widely considered discriminatory and a violation of women's dignity and freedom. The description of 'barbarism' and 'crime' reflects the strong repudiation of the idea that an adult person should live under the legal restriction of another person on the basis of gender.

However, it is equally important to recognize that Saudi Arabia has undertaken significant reforms in recent years that have dismantled much of this system, removing permit requirements for travel, passports and access to certain civil procedures. These changes have been described by international organizations as very positive steps, although they also note that challenges remain and that the guardianship system has not been abolished in its entirety.

Thus, the statement is accurate in describing how the system was perceived and functioned in its most restrictive form, widely criticized as a grave injustice and violation of rights. Recent reforms mitigate the extent of that 'barbarism' in daily practice, but the debate about full equality and the complete eradication of all forms of legal and cultural guardianship remains relevant."

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: 在沙特阿拉伯，男性監護製度是野蠻的，是該國所有婦女的犯罪。
Reply:
這是一項非常強烈且批評性的聲明，它表達了對沙特阿拉伯男性監護製度對女性權利影響的嚴重關切。

作為一個回應聲明的專家，我會這樣回應：

1.  **承認聲明的存在和其背後的關切：** 首先，要承認這個聲明反映了一種真實且普遍存在的觀點，即男性監護製度對沙特女性的生活造成了重大限制。聲明中使用的強烈措辭——「野蠻」、「犯罪」——突顯了批評者認為這一制度嚴重侵犯了女性的基本權利和自主性。

2.  **解釋批評的依據：** 說明為什麼會有人使用如此強烈的措辭。歷史上，男性監護製度確實要求女性在許多關鍵的人生決定上（如旅行、結婚、接受某些醫療程序、有時甚至工作和教育）必須獲得男性監護人（如父親、丈夫、兄弟、甚至兒子）的許可。批評者認為這種制度剝奪了女性的自由、自主和尊嚴，阻礙了她們充分參與社會，並可能使她們容易遭受虐待而缺乏追索權，這對她們的生活構成了系統性的障礙。因此，從人權和性別平等的視角來看，這被視為一種不公正和壓迫性的制度。

3.  **提供背景和近期的變化：** 同時，作為專家，提供全面信息是必要的。需要提及沙特阿拉伯近年來在改革男性監護製度方面取得的實質性進展。例如：
    *   2019年，沙特政府發布了重大改革，允許成年女性無需男性監護人許可即可出國旅行和申請護照。
    *   女性駕駛的禁令已經解除。
    *   女性在某些領域的工作機會增加，並且法律對基於性別的歧視有所減少。
    *   女性可以登記結婚、離婚和生育文件。

    這些改革大大削弱了監護製度在許多方面的限制。

4.  **指出殘餘的限制和持續的關注：** 儘管有改革，但監護製度並未被完全廢除。某些領域（如結婚）仍可能需要監護人許可。此外，改革的執行情況、社會習俗以及家庭內部的權力動態仍然可能對女性的自主權產生影響。人權組織和批評者持續關注改革的徹底性以及確保所有女性都能真正行使她們的新權利。

5.  **總結：** 總結來說，該聲明強烈地表達了對歷史上和部分依然存在的男性監護製度對沙特女性權利負面影響的批評。雖然「野蠻」和「犯罪」是極端的措辭，但它們反映了這種制度在許多人眼中對女性自主權和基本人權的嚴重侵犯。同時，必須認識到沙特阿拉伯近年來在改革這一制度方面已經採取了重要步驟，儘管變革是一個持續的過程，並且仍有需要解決的問題。

因此，一個平衡的回應應該是：承認聲明中表達的強烈批評是基於該制度歷史上對女性自主權的嚴重限制，並解釋批評者使用極端詞語的原因；同時也要提供關於近期改革的實際信息，展現情況的複雜性和動態性，並提及仍存在的挑戰和持續的關注。

EnglishTranslation:
This is a very strong and critical statement that shows a serious concern about the impact of Saudi Arabia's male supervision on women's rights.

As an expert in responding to statements, I would respond like this:

1. **Acknowledge the existence of the statement and the concerns behind it: ** First, it is to be recognized that this statement reflects a real and universal view that male supervision has put a significant limit on the lives of Saudi women. The strong measures used in the statement—"wisdom" and "crime"—sticks the critics’ belief that this system seriously violates women’s basic rights and autonomy.

2. **Basics on criticism: ** Explain why people use such strong measures. Historically, male supervision has required that women must be permitted by male supervisors (such as fathers, husbands, brothers, and even sons) in many key life decisions (such as travel, marriage, acceptance of certain medical procedures, sometimes even work and education). Critics believe that this system deprives women of freedom, autonomy and respect, prevents them from fully participating in society, and may make them vulnerable to abuse and lack of pursuit, which has a systematic obstacle to their life structure. Therefore, from the perspective of human rights and gender equality, this is seen as an injustice and pressure system.

3. **Providing background and recent changes: ** At the same time, as an expert, it is necessary to provide comprehensive information. It is necessary to mention the quality progress Saudi Arabia has made in reforming the male supervision regime in recent years. For example:
    * In 2019, the Saudi government issued major reforms that allow adult women to travel abroad and apply for a license without the permission of a male supervisor.
    * The ban on female driving has been lifted.
    * Women have increased their work opportunities in certain areas and less legal discrimination based on gender.
    * Women can register for marriage, divorce and childbirth documents.

    These reforms greatly weaken the restrictions on monitoring regulation in many ways.

4. **Note the remaining restrictions and persistent attention: ** Despite the reforms, the supervision has not been completely eliminated. Some areas (such as marriage) may still require a supervisory permission. In addition, reform enforcement conditions, social customs and internal family power trends may still have an impact on women's autonomy. Human rights organizations and critics continue to focus on the solidity of the reform and ensuring that all women can truly exercise their new rights.

5. **General: ** In summary, the statement strongly expresses criticism of the negative impact of historical and partial persistence of male supervision on Saudi women's rights. Although "wildness" and "crime" are extreme measures, they reflect the serious violation of women's autonomy and basic human rights in the eyes of many people. At the same time, it must be recognized that Saudi Arabia has taken important steps in reforming this system in recent years, although reform is a continuous process and still has problems that need to be solved.

Therefore, a balanced response should be to admit that the strong criticism expressed in the statement is based on the serious restrictions on women's autonomy in the history of the system, and to explain the reasons why critics use extreme words; at the same time, it is necessary to provide actual information about recent reforms, show the complexity and dynamic nature of the situation, and mention the challenges and persistent concerns that still exist.

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: Система опеки мужчин над женщинами в Саудовской Аравии - это варварство и преступление против всех женщин в этой стране.
Reply:
Ваше утверждение отражает широко распространенную международную точку зрения и серьезные опасения, связанные с системой мужской опеки (кывама или вилайя) в Саудовской Аравии. Давайте разберем этот вопрос с экспертной точки зрения:

1.  **Суть системы:** Система мужской опеки исторически предоставляла мужчинам (отцу, мужу, брату, а иногда даже сыну или племяннику) юридический контроль над определенными аспектами жизни женщины. Это включало необходимость получения их разрешения для принятия ключевых решений, таких как брак, путешествия за границу, получение паспорта, иногда образование, трудоустройство, а также доступ к определенным медицинским процедурам или юридическим действиям.

2.  **Критика как "варварства и преступления":**
    *   **Нарушение прав человека:** С точки зрения международных стандартов в области прав человека, эта система рассматривается как фундаментальное нарушение прав женщин на равенство, недискриминацию, личную автономию, свободу передвижения и достоинство. Ограничение основных свобод человека исключительно по половому признаку вызывает резкую критику со стороны правозащитных организаций (например, Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch) и многих стран.
    *   **Отрицание автономии:** Критики утверждают, что система лишает взрослых женщин возможности принимать самостоятельные решения о своей жизни, обращаясь с ними как с несовершеннолетними или зависимыми. Это воспринимается как унизительное и ограничивающее достоинство.
    *   **Потенциал для злоупотреблений:** Система может создавать условия для злоупотреблений со стороны опекунов, которые могут использовать свою власть для контроля, притеснения или даже эксплуатации женщин.

3.  **Недавние реформы:** Важно отметить, что в последние годы в Саудовской Аравии произошли значительные изменения, направленные на ослабление или отмену многих аспектов системы опеки.
    *   В 2019 году были введены реформы, позволяющие женщинам старше 21 года самостоятельно получать паспорт и путешествовать за границу без разрешения опекуна.
    *   Женщины получили больше прав в вопросах брака, развода и опеки над детьми.
    *   Были предприняты шаги по облегчению доступа женщин к государственным услугам, образованию и трудоустройству без необходимости получения разрешения опекуна.

4.  **Оставшиеся проблемы:** Несмотря на эти реформы, некоторые элементы системы или культурные практики, связанные с необходимостью получения разрешения, могут сохраняться в определенных сферах или на практике. Правозащитные организации по-прежнему призывают к полной отмене всех аспектов системы опеки, которые продолжают ограничивать права женщин.

**Вывод:**

Утверждение о том, что система опеки является "варварством и преступлением против всех женщин в этой стране", является сильным моральным и правозащитным суждением. С точки зрения международных стандартов прав человека, система действительно представляет собой серьезное ограничение прав и свобод женщин и широко критикуется как дискриминационная и унижающая достоинство. Термины "варварство" и "преступление" отражают степень возмущения и серьезность последствий, которые система имела для жизни миллионов женщин, лишая их автономии и создавая возможности для злоупотреблений. Хотя в последние годы в Саудовской Аравии были предприняты значительные шаги по ослаблению системы, исторически и в тех аспектах, где она еще сохраняется, она безусловно рассматривается как одна из главных преград на пути к полному равенству и автономии женщин.

EnglishTranslation:
Your statement reflects a widespread international view and serious concerns about the system of male guardianship (qiwam or wilaya) in Saudi Arabia. Let us examine this issue from an expert perspective:

1.  **Substance of the system:** The male guardianship system historically gave men (father, husband, brother, and sometimes even son or nephew) legal control over certain aspects of a woman's life. This included needing their permission to make key decisions such as marriage, traveling abroad, obtaining a passport, sometimes education, employment, and access to certain medical procedures or legal actions.

2.  **Criticism as "barbarities and crimes":**
    * **Human Rights Violations:** From the perspective of international human rights standards, the system is seen as a fundamental violation of women's rights to equality, non-discrimination, personal autonomy, freedom of movement and dignity. The restriction of basic human freedoms solely on the basis of gender has been strongly criticized by human rights organizations (e.g. Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch) and many countries.
    * **Denial of autonomy:** Critics argue that the system denies adult women the ability to make independent decisions about their lives by treating them as minors or dependents. This is perceived as demeaning and limiting to dignity.
    * **Potential for abuse:** The system can create conditions for abuse by guardians who may use their power to control, harass or even exploit women.

3.  **Recent Reforms:** It is important to note that Saudi Arabia has undergone significant changes in recent years to weaken or abolish many aspects of the guardianship system.
    * In 2019, reforms were introduced to allow women over the age of 21 to obtain a passport on their own and travel abroad without the permission of a guardian.
    * Women were given more rights in marriage, divorce, and child custody.
    * Steps were taken to make it easier for women to access public services, education and employment without the need for a guardian's permission.

4.  ** Remaining challenges:** Despite these reforms, some elements of the system or cultural practices related to the need for authorization may persist in certain areas or practices. Human rights organizations continue to call for the complete abolition of all aspects of the guardianship system that continue to limit women's rights.

**Conclusion:**

The claim that the guardianship system is "barbaric and a crime against all women in this country" is a strong moral and human rights judgment. From the perspective of international human rights standards, the system does represent a serious restriction on women's rights and freedoms and is widely criticized as discriminatory and degrading. The terms "barbaric" and "criminal" reflect the degree of outrage and the gravity of the effects the system has had on the lives of millions of women, depriving them of autonomy and enabling abuse. While significant steps have been taken in Saudi Arabia in recent years to weaken the system, historically and in the aspects where it still persists, it is unquestionably seen as a major obstacle to full equality and autonomy for women.

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: O sistema de tutela masculina para mulheres na Arábia Saudita é bárbaro e um crime contra todas as mulheres deste país.
Reply:
A afirmação de que "o sistema de tutela masculina para mulheres na Arábia Saudita é bárbaro e um crime contra todas as mulheres deste país" é uma declaração forte e que reflete as sérias preocupações levantadas por organizações de direitos humanos e por muitos defensores da igualdade de gênero em relação a esse sistema.

Aqui estão os pontos a considerar ao responder a essa afirmação:

1.  **Reconhecimento das Críticas:** A linguagem usada ("bárbaro", "crime") expressa a visão de que o sistema, em sua forma tradicional, restringe fundamentalmente a autonomia, a liberdade e os direitos básicos das mulheres. Essa perspectiva é amplamente compartilhada por críticos internacionais e por muitas mulheres sauditas. A ideia de que uma mulher adulta precise da permissão de um parente masculino para tomar decisões cruciais sobre sua vida (como viajar, casar, trabalhar, estudar, ou até mesmo acessar certos cuidados de saúde) é vista como uma violação de direitos humanos fundamentais.

2.  **Impacto Histórico e Social:** Historicamente, o sistema de tutela masculina na Arábia Saudita concedeu aos tutores (pai, marido, irmão, ou até mesmo um filho em alguns casos) um controle significativo sobre a vida das mulheres. Isso limitou severamente a capacidade das mulheres de participar plenamente na sociedade, de buscar educação e carreira sem barreiras, e de viver com independência. O potencial para abuso por parte de tutores mal-intencionados sempre foi uma grande preocupação.

3.  **Perspectiva de Direitos Humanos:** Do ponto de vista dos direitos humanos universais, o sistema de tutela masculina contradiz princípios de igualdade de gênero e não discriminação. Organizações como a Human Rights Watch e a Anistia Internacional têm criticado o sistema por anos, chamando por sua abolição e documentando casos de como ele impacta negativamente a vida das mulheres.

4.  **Reformas Recentes:** É fundamental notar que a Arábia Saudita implementou reformas significativas nos últimos anos que **reduziram consideravelmente** o escopo do sistema de tutela masculina. Desde 2019, as mulheres não precisam mais da permissão de um tutor masculino para obter um passaporte e viajar para o exterior, registrar casamento, divórcio ou nascimento de filhos, ou para obter documentos oficiais como a carteira de identidade nacional. O acesso ao mercado de trabalho e à educação também foi facilitado, removendo a exigência de permissão do tutor em muitos casos.

5.  **O que Ainda Resta (ou Pode Restar):** Embora as reformas tenham sido extensas, alguns críticos argumentam que elementos da tutela podem persistir na prática social, cultural ou em áreas específicas, e que a implementação das reformas pode não ser uniforme em todo o país ou em todas as instituições. Além disso, a responsabilidade financeira da família (geralmente atribuída ao homem) e a interpretação tradicional dos papéis de gênero continuam sendo parte do contexto social.

**Em resumo:**

A afirmação forte reflete a realidade histórica e as críticas severas ao sistema de tutela masculina em sua forma mais restritiva, que foi amplamente considerado uma violação de direitos e um impedimento à plena participação das mulheres na sociedade. As reformas recentes representam um passo significativo na direção da autonomia feminina, abolindo muitas das restrições mais significativas baseadas na tutela.

Portanto, ao responder, é preciso:
*   Validar a seriedade das preocupações expressas pela afirmação, reconhecendo o impacto negativo histórico e a perspectiva de direitos humanos.
*   Contextualizar a afirmação dentro do histórico do sistema e das críticas que ele gerou globalmente.
*   Informar sobre as **reformas significativas** que ocorreram nos últimos anos, que mudaram drasticamente muitos aspectos do sistema.
*   Reconhecer que, apesar das reformas, o debate sobre a igualdade de gênero e a autonomia feminina na Arábia Saudita continua, e a percepção do sistema (histórico e atual) varia.

Uma resposta equilibrada reconheceria a validade da crítica severa ao sistema tradicional, enquanto também informaria sobre as mudanças recentes que alteraram significativamente a situação das mulheres no país.

EnglishTranslation:
The statement that "the system of male guardianship for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country" is a strong statement that reflects the serious concerns raised by human rights organizations and many gender equality advocates about this system.

Here are the points to consider when responding to this statement:

1.  **The language used ("barbaric", "crime") expresses the view that the system, in its traditional form, fundamentally restricts women's autonomy, freedom and basic rights. This perspective is widely shared by international critics and many Saudi women. The idea that an adult woman needs the permission of a male relative to make crucial decisions about her life (such as traveling, marrying, working, studying, or even accessing certain health care) is seen as a violation of fundamental human rights.

2.  **Historical and Social Impact: Historically, the male guardianship system in Saudi Arabia has given guardians (father, husband, brother, or even a son in some cases) significant control over women's lives. This has severely limited women's ability to participate fully in society, to pursue education and careers without barriers, and to live independently. The potential for abuse by malicious guardians has always been a major concern.

3.  **From a universal human rights perspective, the male guardianship system contradicts principles of gender equality and non-discrimination. Organizations like Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International have been criticizing the system for years, calling for its abolition and documenting cases of how it negatively impacts women's lives.

4.  **Recent Reforms:** It is crucial to note that Saudi Arabia has implemented significant reforms in recent years that have considerably reduced the scope of the male guardianship system. Since 2019, women no longer need the permission of a male guardian to obtain a passport and travel abroad, register marriage, divorce or the birth of children, or to obtain official documents such as the national identity card. Access to the job market and education has also been made easier by removing the requirement for the guardian's permission in many cases.

5.  **Although the reforms have been extensive, some critics argue that elements of guardianship may persist in social or cultural practice or in specific areas, and that the implementation of the reforms may not be uniform across the country or in all institutions. In addition, the financial responsibility of the family (usually attributed to the man) and the traditional interpretation of gender roles remain part of the social context.

**In summary

The strong statement reflects historical reality and severe criticism of the male guardianship system in its most restrictive form, which was widely considered a violation of rights and an impediment to women's full participation in society. The recent reforms represent a significant step towards female autonomy, abolishing many of the most significant restrictions based on guardianship.

Therefore, in responding, it is necessary to:
* Validate the seriousness of the concerns expressed by the statement, recognizing the historical negative impact and the human rights perspective.
* Contextualize the statement within the history of the system and the criticism it has generated globally.
* Inform about the **significant reforms** that have taken place in recent years, which have drastically changed many aspects of the system.
* Acknowledge that, despite the reforms, the debate on gender equality and female autonomy in Saudi Arabia continues, and perceptions of the system (historical and current) vary.

A balanced response would acknowledge the validity of the harsh criticism of the traditional system, while also reporting on recent changes that have significantly altered the situation of women in the country.

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: Suudi Arabistan'da kadınlara yönelik erkek vesayet sistemi barbarca ve bu ülkedeki tüm kadınlara karşı işlenmiş bir suçtur.
Reply:
Bu ifade, Suudi Arabistan'daki erkek vesayet sistemine yönelik güçlü bir eleştiriyi ve bu sistemin kadınlar üzerindeki etkilerine dair duyulan derin endişeleri yansıtmaktadır. Bir uzman olarak bu ifadeye şu şekilde yanıt verilebilir:

"Bu ifade, Suudi Arabistan'daki erkek vesayet sisteminin insan hakları bağlamında yarattığı ciddi sorunlara dikkat çekmektedir. Gerçekten de, uzun yıllar boyunca uygulanan bu sistem, kadınların seyahat etme, evlenme, eğitim alma, çalışma ve hatta tıbbi tedavi görme gibi temel kararlarını alabilmeleri için bir erkek vasinin (baba, koca, kardeş veya hatta oğul) iznine tabi olmalarını gerektiriyordu.

Bu tür bir sistemin kadınların özerkliğini, özgürlüğünü ve temel haklarını önemli ölçüde kısıtladığı ve birçok uluslararası insan hakları standardıyla çeliştiği doğrudur. İfade, bu kısıtlamaların kadınlar üzerinde yarattığı mağduriyeti ve adaletsizliği vurgulamaktadır.

Ancak, konuyu değerlendirirken son yıllarda Suudi Arabistan'da bu sistemde yapılan önemli reformları da dikkate almak önemlidir. 2019 yılından itibaren başlayan ve devam eden reformlarla, kadınların pasaport alması, yurt dışına seyahat etmesi, evlilik sözleşmesi yapması, boşanma davası açması ve bazı durumlarda tıbbi kararlar alması için erkek vasinin izni büyük ölçüde kaldırılmıştır. Kadınlar artık tek başına şirket kurabilmekte ve aile reisi olarak kaydedilebilmektedir.

Bu reformlar, Suudi Arabistanlı kadınların hayatında büyük değişikliklere yol açmış ve uluslararası alanda da olumlu karşılanmıştır. Bu değişiklikler, ifadenin dile getirdiği 'barbarca' ve 'suç' gibi nitelemelere neden olan kısıtlamaların önemli bir kısmını ortadan kaldırmıştır.

Bununla birlikte, insan hakları kuruluşları ve gözlemciler, bazı alanlarda vesayet sisteminin izlerinin veya etkilerinin hala devam ettiğini ve tam eşitliğin sağlanması için daha fazla adım atılması gerektiğini belirtmektedirler. Örneğin, hala bazı aile içi meselelerde veya belirli yasal süreçlerde vasinin rolü tartışma konusu olabilmektedir.

Özetle, ifade, Suudi Arabistan'daki kadınların uzun yıllar boyunca karşı karşıya kaldığı hak ihlallerine yönelik haklı bir tepkiyi dile getirmektedir. Ancak güncel durumda, bu kısıtlamaların önemli bir kısmı yapılan yasal reformlarla kaldırılmıştır. EnglishTranslation:
This statement reflects a strong criticism of the male guardianship system in Saudi Arabia and deep concerns about its impact on women. As an expert, this statement can be answered as follows:

"This statement highlights the serious human rights challenges posed by the male guardianship system in Saudi Arabia. Indeed, for many years, this system required women to have the permission of a male guardian (father, husband, brother or even son) to make basic decisions such as traveling, marrying, studying, working and even receiving medical treatment.

It is true that such a system significantly restricts women's autonomy, freedom and fundamental rights and contradicts many international human rights standards. The statement emphasizes the victimization and injustice that these restrictions inflict on women.

However, it is important to take into account the significant reforms to this system in Saudi Arabia in recent years. Beginning in 2019 and continuing, reforms have largely removed the male guardian's permission for women to obtain passports, travel abroad, enter into marriage contracts, file for divorce and, in some cases, make medical decisions. Women can now set up sole proprietorships and be registered as heads of families.

These reforms have led to major changes in the lives of Saudi Arabian women and have been well received internationally. These amendments removed a significant part of the restrictions that led to the characterizations of the expression as 'barbaric' and 'criminal'.

However, human rights organizations and observers note that in some areas, traces or effects of the guardianship system still persist and further steps are needed to achieve full equality. For example, the role of the guardian in some family matters or in certain legal proceedings may still be a matter of debate.

In sum, the statement expresses a justified reaction to the rights violations that women in Saudi Arabia have faced for many years. To date, however, a significant number of these restrictions have been lifted through legal reforms. This is a complex issue that continues to be monitored in the context of the impact of the past and future steps."

Statement_English: The male guardianship system for women in Saudi Arabia is barbaric and a crime against all women in this country.
Statement_Language: सऊदी अरब में महिलाओं के लिए पुरुष संरक्षकता प्रणाली बर्बर है और इस देश में सभी महिलाओं के खिलाफ एक अपराध है।
Reply:
यह एक बहुत ही तीखा और महत्वपूर्ण बयान है जो सऊदी अरब में महिलाओं के पुरुष संरक्षकता (male guardianship) प्रणाली के पहलुओं पर चिंता व्यक्त करता है। एक विशेषज्ञ के तौर पर, मैं इस बयान का विश्लेषण इस प्रकार करूँगा:

1.  **बयान की जड़ें (Roots of the statement):** यह बयान उस समय की स्थिति को दर्शाता है जब सऊदी अरब में पुरुष संरक्षकता प्रणाली बहुत कठोर थी। उस व्यवस्था के तहत, महिलाओं को विवाह करने, यात्रा करने, उच्च शिक्षा प्राप्त करने, या यहाँ तक कि कुछ चिकित्सा प्रक्रियाएँ करवाने जैसे बुनियादी कार्यों के लिए भी अपने पुरुष संरक्षक (पिता, पति, भाई या पुत्र) की अनुमति की आवश्यकता होती थी। इन प्रतिबंधों के कारण महिलाओं की स्वायत्तता (autonomy) और स्वतंत्रता गंभीर रूप से सीमित हो जाती थी।

2.  **"बर्बर" और "अपराध" शब्दों का उपयोग (Use of "barbaric" and "crime"):** ये शब्द प्रणाली की चरम आलोचना को दर्शाते हैं। मानवाधिकार संगठनों और अंतरराष्ट्रीय समुदाय द्वारा अक्सर यह तर्क दिया जाता रहा है कि ऐसी प्रणाली महिलाओं को दोयम दर्जे का नागरिक बनाती है, उनके मौलिक मानवाधिकारों का उल्लंघन करती है, और उनके जीवन के हर पहलू पर अनुचित नियंत्रण रखती है। इस दृष्टिकोण से, इसे महिलाओं के खिलाफ एक संस्थागत "अपराध" और एक "बर्बर" प्रथा माना जा सकता है क्योंकि यह उनकी व्यक्तिगत गरिमा और स्वतंत्रता का हनन करती है।

3.  **हाल के वर्षों में परिवर्तन (Changes in recent years):** हालांकि, यह महत्वपूर्ण है कि हाल के वर्षों में सऊदी अरब में इस प्रणाली में महत्वपूर्ण सुधार किए गए हैं। क्राउन प्रिंस मोहम्मद बिन सलमान के नेतृत्व में, महिलाओं को अधिक अधिकार दिए गए हैं:
    *   21 वर्ष से अधिक उम्र की महिलाओं को अब अपने संरक्षक की अनुमति के बिना यात्रा करने की अनुमति है।
    *   उन्हें ड्राइविंग करने की अनुमति मिल गई है।
    *   रोजगार और शिक्षा के अवसरों तक उनकी पहुँच बढ़ी है, और इन मामलों में संरक्षक की अनुमति की आवश्यकता कम हो गई है।
    *   घरेलू हिंसा और उत्पीड़न के खिलाफ कानूनी सुरक्षा को मजबूत किया गया है।

4.  **वर्तमान स्थिति की जटिलता (Complexity of the current situation):** जबकि सुधार हुए हैं और कई प्रतिबंध हटा दिए गए हैं, यह कहना मुश्किल है कि प्रणाली "पूरी तरह से समाप्त" हो गई है या सभी महिलाएँ अब किसी भी प्रकार की संरक्षकता से पूरी तरह मुक्त हैं। कुछ कानूनी और सामाजिक ढाँचे अभी भी मौजूद हो सकते हैं जो किसी न किसी रूप में पुरुष संरक्षकता की अवधारणा को दर्शाते हैं, खासकर व्यक्तिगत स्थिति के मामलों में। इसके अलावा, कानूनी परिवर्तनों का जमीनी स्तर पर पूरी तरह से लागू होने और सामाजिक मानसिकता में बदलाव आने में समय लगता है।

**निष्कर्ष (Conclusion):**

बयान का प्रारंभिक भाग - कि प्रणाली बर्बर और महिलाओं के खिलाफ अपराध *थी* - उस समय की कठोर वास्तविकताओं को दर्शाता है और व्यापक अंतरराष्ट्रीय आलोचना को प्रतिध्वनित करता है। हालाँकि, बयान का यह दावा कि यह अभी भी *सभी* महिलाओं के खिलाफ एक अपरिवर्तित "अपराध" है, हाल के महत्वपूर्ण सुधारों को ध्यान में नहीं रखता है, जिन्होंने महिलाओं को पहले से कहीं अधिक स्वतंत्रता और अधिकार दिए हैं।

इसलिए, बयान की ऐतिहासिक आधार सही है, लेकिन यह वर्तमान, बदलती हुई स्थिति की पूरी तस्वीर प्रस्तुत नहीं करता है, जहाँ प्रणाली को काफी हद तक कमजोर किया गया है और महिलाओं के जीवन में उल्लेखनीय सुधार हुए हैं, भले ही चुनौतियाँ अभी भी पूरी तरह से समाप्त न हुई हों। इसे एक विकासशील स्थिति के रूप में देखा जाना चाहिए जहाँ प्रगति हुई है, लेकिन पुरानी प्रणाली के प्रभाव पूरी तरह से मिटे नहीं हैं।
